Technique: BURNED, OXIDIZED; ENGOBE; FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; PAINTED
Name: Jug
Description: Ovoidal receptacle with narrow mouth, short bottleneck and unstable base with convex bottom. Orangey-coloured paste and exterior surface covered with a reddish-coloured coating, The upper third of the body bears a painted decoration: three vertical elements in the shape of teardrops, in white, forming a series.
